Hydras/perceptor/

"And you, Perceptor?"hissed Hydras while he looked at 
Perceptor"What's your opinion?"

"All the plans and suggestion are good"hissed Perceptor "Perhaps we 
can convine those plans in one... Step One: find an allie in our 
fight against Maximals. But few tribes offer good perspectives.... 
NWO and Rouges. Step two, Sandtorm plan will be perfect in the 
battle, but we have to choose the battlefield before MAximals do it. 
Step three, we have to wait until we get news about our spy... "

"But when he speak we us, we can't tell him  about sabotage the 
Maximal's shields"replie Hydras.

"He did it"said Perceptor "He has... a lot initiative" said devilish 
Perceptor

"What about the hostage...?"

"We can use a closest of Rodimus anyway"replied Perceptor"Who will 
suspect that one of the closest friends of Rodimus is a spy who was 
reprogramed to serve us....?" ais Perceptor

Looking to Predacons, Hydras said "Any other suggestion?"

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "raccoon7679 <raccoon7679@y...>" 
--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Hollywood Narrator" 
<hollywood.narrator@v...> wrote:
> Sandstorm thought about the question.
> Proto nodded. "A cell thats easy, and itll be fool proof as well. 
As for an 
> alliance I am not one to answer that question since ive been out 
of the loop 
> lately. I have only this to say if one thing is true all preds 
hate preds so 
> if theyre are any other pred tribes out here try them."

> Sandstorm: If the Predacons have enough men, this could work. A 
few of us could lead an equal amount of Maximals or more away, give 
them the impression of dominance, then when they reach some suitable 
hiding places, the rest of us jump them. Eliminate a few Maximals at 
a time, just until they catch on, and they'll soon he outnumbered. 
But how to make them notice? ... With some of them we could play off 
their egos, perhaps, but I'm sure there are those who are looking to 
be heroes, taking out a Predacon alone would seem very "tough" of 
them, after all.
> 
<raccoon7679@y...> wrote:
> KitKat::
> 
> She listened to the discusion.  "I have a recommendation 
Commander. 
> Why not try to attack from several differnt vantage points? First, 
> let the spy think we will take out thier bases main power supply, 
> there by misleading them for surely the spy will tell them of our 
> plan. Then, we send another in to take a hostage. Not the one 
closest 
> one to thier leader, but the one with most knowlage of thier base 
and 
> weapons and tactics. Then we reprogram that bot to our side. In 
the 
> mean time, we attack from the front and side with a main assault. 
We 
> do what damage we can to thier base and leave. With the hostage 
> converted to our side we can find another way to create more 
damage 
> to them and possable bring them down for good. this is my humble 
> opinion Commander Hydras."
